central_thesis: This Scroll serves as an internal communication for the Temple of Set, providing updates on upcoming events like the Set-V Conclave, recognizing member achievements, and offering practical and philosophical guidance rooted in the acquisition and application of 'information' as a core magical principle for personal development and power within the world.

structure_content.summary: This article outlines the purpose, location (Santa Cruz), and preliminary schedule of the Set-V Conclave, emphasizing its design to benefit individual Setians, foster new friendships, and re-energize old ones, while also serving as an attractive vacation spot. It details general meetings, ritual workings, and social activities, and invites members to submit presentation proposals relevant to Temple concerns.

This short announcement formally recognizes Aime O'Brien, Jim Grady, and Stephen Flowers as Adepts II° within the Temple of Set, noting their sponsors (Priest Robert Menschel, Priest Roger Whitaker, and Priestess Betty Ford, respectively). It concludes with an esoteric quote related to refreshment and unheard answers.

structure_content.chapter_title: [3] The Amazing Herschell Gordon Lewis and his World of Exploitation Films
structure_content.summary: Presented as a book review, this article delves into the significance of information as the primary tool of a Black Magician. It uses exploitation filmmaker H.G. Lewis as an example of someone adept at spotting and leveraging popular trends. The author posits that the ability to identify and exploit trends, much like Lewis did in film, is crucial for a successful magician to 'make a profit' and gain 'power' in their interactions with the world. It also suggests that computers are an extension of the magician's will.

This article provides practical advice for Setians on how to acquire books at a discount, suggesting various services like Barnes and Noble Bookstores and the History Book Club. It frames the acquisition of 'valuable initiatory information' through books as essential for personal knowledge and future development, especially for those on limited budgets, connecting this practical advice to the broader Setian path.

key_concepts.definition: The core tool of a Black Magician, described as the source of power. The most powerful magician possesses the most information. This includes the ability to spot general trends and movements, historical and contemporary.
A film that exploits current trends, taboos, and topics of general interest. Used as a model for how a magician should identify and leverage trends in the world.
One who effectively uses information, understands popular trends, and applies this knowledge within their interactions with the world to achieve personal 'profit' or power.

A gathering for members of the Temple of Set, designed for individual benefit, fostering community, conducting Temple business, and engaging in ritual events. Also intended to serve as an attractive vacation site.
A specific degree of initiation or recognition within the Temple of Set.
Presented as an extension of the magician's will, implying its utility in the acquisition and processing of information.

practical_system.description: The practical system advocated within this Scroll centers on the active acquisition, analysis, and application of information. A practitioner is encouraged to develop an acute awareness of current and historical trends, similar to a successful entrepreneur or cultural observer. This 'trend-spotting' ability is then to be leveraged within one's interactions with the world to achieve personal 'profit' and 'power.' The underlying principle is that superior information leads to superior magical efficacy and worldly success. This system requires constant learning, observation, and strategic application of knowledge rather than rote ritual.
tools: Information (especially concerning current and historical trends)
Computer (as an extension of the magician's will)
Discount book services (to efficiently acquire books)
rituals: Evening Conclave Ritual for all Setians

relevant_quotes.text: As with the Temple as a whole, Conclaves are designed and intended to benefit each individual to the greatest possible extent.
They shall drink from the deepest part of the river. The north wind shall breathe upon them to their refreshment. They shall speak without sound, and shall hear answers unheard." Xeper.
The tool of a Black Magician is information. It really is. Take time to think about it. The most powerful magician will be the one who has the most information.
The sword will be [and has been in many cases] replaced by the computer as an extension of the magician's will.

The point is that H. G. Lewis could spot general trends and movements of popular taste [or lack thereof] before anyone else. When he spotted one of these areas, he made his move, made his money, and went onward.

The lessons to be learned as a magician aren't about the making of exploitation films, and neither are they about how to come in under budget and on schedule. Rather they are the principles of being conscious of the existence of popular trends, and of exploiting these trends within the context of your own interactions with the the world. If you can do this, you will certainly "make a profit"; and perhaps if you consider the matter deeply enough, you will sense a "power" in this type of consciousness, a power that has moved entire nations.
This information is a lesser key for your knowledge and for your future.

critical_analysis.relevance: This Scroll is highly relevant for understanding the practical and philosophical underpinnings of the Temple of Set during the mid-1980s. It demonstrates a pragmatic approach to occultism, framing 'information' and 'trend-spotting' as critical magical tools, aligning with a results-oriented, individualistic path. The articles illustrate how the Temple integrates administrative functions (Conclaves, recognitions) with core teachings on self-empowerment and the acquisition of knowledge for magical efficacy. The emphasis on contemporary parallels (exploitation films, computers) suggests a modern, adaptable interpretation of magical practice. It reinforces the idea that occult wisdom can be found in unconventional sources and applied to worldly success, resonating with a left-hand path philosophy.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is primarily members and initiates of the Temple of Set. The content assumes familiarity with Temple terminology (e.g., Xeper, degrees of initiation) and internal references (e.g., previous Scroll issues). It aims to inform, guide, and motivate members in their personal magical work, community engagement, and understanding of the Temple's philosophy and operations. The practical advice on acquiring books and attending Conclaves caters directly to the membership's needs and interests.
